Direct message the job poster from Southern California Edison (SCE)
Leanne Hua
Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant at Southern California Edison seeking talent for professionals passionate about energy and sustainability!
Job DescriptionJoin the Clean Energy RevolutionBecome a Principal Manager of Insights & Analytics at Southern California Edison (SCE) and build a better tomorrow. In this job, you will report to the Director of Customer Experience and is critical to building a customer centric culture at SCE. The successful candidate will create a vision for the team that helps us deeply understand our customers, deliver understandable and useful insights and analytics, and drive action that improves customer experience and operational effectiveness.This role is responsible for expanding our Voice of Customer program, continuing the development of our insights and analytics capabilities, and ultimately influencing change for our customers. You should apply for this position if you are passionate about the customer experience, data driven decision making, getting results, and building great teams and internal partnerships.As a Principal Manager, your work will help power our planet, reduce carbon emissions and create cleaner air for everyone. Are you ready to take on the challenge to help us build the future?A day in the life - Get ready to think big, work smart and shine bright!Develop: Develop the long-term vision for the team and the insights and analytics roadmap. Develop the skills and capabilities of the team.Lead: Lead the execution of the team's vision and data analytics roadmap. Lead a team to turn data into understandable and actionable insights to achieve tangible results that improve the experience for our customers and our internal effectiveness.Build: Build scalable internal systems, models, and processes that allow for the delivery of impactful and actionable insights. Build and expand our Voice of Customer program. Build business cases that support the work we do and show why it is essential for the customer and SCE.Partner: Partner with internal collaborators to understand their data needs and deepen the culture of customer data-driven decision making. Partner with external vendors to deliver on our vision and roadmap. Partner with other data teams to increase our capabilities and effectiveness.Advocate: Advocate for our customers and influence change with the data and insights to back it up.QualificationsThe essentialsEight or more years of business intelligence, data analytics, data modeling, insights development experienceSeven or more years of experience managing, supervising, or leading an organization, unit, or teams.Experience with data tools/languages and CX PlatformsManagement skills including negotiating, leadership, delegation, strategic and organizational planningThe PreferredBachelor’s degree or higher in mathematics, statistics, finance, data science or related fieldUnderstanding of CX strategy and design principalsExperience developing compelling business casesClean and concise verbal/written communicationAbility to build relationships and influence change at all levels and areas of the companyYou should knowThis position’s work mode is hybrid. The employee will report to an SCE facility for a set number of days with the option to work remotely on the remaining days. Unless otherwise noted, employees are required to reside in the state of California. Further details of this work mode will be discussed at the interview stage.Visit our Candidate Resource page to get meaningful information related to benefits, perks, resources, testing information, hiring process, and more!Relocation may apply to this position. TestingThis position requires testing and applicants who are identified to continue through the selection process will be invited to test via email. Reference our Information Guides for the following test: Edison Leadership Workstyles (Test #8201). Candidates who have previously passed these assessment(s), in some cases, may not need to retest again for this position.About Southern California EdisonThe people at SCE don't just keep the lights on. Our mission is so much bigger. We’re fueling the kind of innovation that’s changing an entire industry, and quite possibly the planet. Join us and create a future with cleaner energy, while providing our customers with the safety and reliability they demand. At SCE, you’ll have a chance to grow personally and professionally, making a real impact in Southern California and around the world.At SCE, we celebrate our differences. We are a proud Equal Opportunity Employer and will not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status or any other protected status.We are committed to ensuring that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodations at (833) 343-0727.
